title: Fort Raleigh National Historic Site: Be A Junior Ranger
body: Be A Junior Ranger       The Junior Ranger Program is a fun way to learn more about our park and how you can help protect it - just like our park rangers! The Junior Ranger Program at Fort Raleigh National Historic Site is designed for kids ages 3 to 13. This program can only be completed while you are at the park--we do not mail out booklets or badges. To become an official Fort Raleigh Roanoke Ranger during the summer program season (mid-June to Labor Day), you will need to: 1) Attend one ranger program or watch the film in the visitor center - check for a program schedule when you arrive at the park. 2) Complete the Junior Ranger booklet appropriate for your age - you can get a copy of the booklet at our visitor center. If you finish the programs and the booklet, you will receive a Junior Ranger badge! If you are visiting the park during any other time period, you can earn a Junior Ranger badge by completing the appropriate portion of the booklet and attending the movie. If you are not able to visit the park, you can still become a National Park Service Junior Ranger on-line and learn about the jobs of park rangers. Visit this site www.nps.gov/webrangers and learn about this fascinating line of work. Complete all the activities and you can become a Web-Ranger!
